title: Perspectives on In/stability
copy:
Perspectives on In/stability

This publication, the first in the three-volume Perspectives series, explores how stability and instability manifest in and shape artworks, the narratives we tell about them, and how we present them.

Forces of In/stability
The Color of Fire Is Flux
From Cloth to Clay: Identities and Im/permanence in Moche Ceramics
Edo Spaces, European Images: Iterations of Art and Architecture of Benin
Empty Fields Revisited
Credits
Seeking Balance: Material and Meaning in a Polychrome Guanyin
Director’s Foreword
Stability Isn’t Everything It’s Glitched Up to Be: An Interview with Jamie Fenton
Seven-Figure Settlements and Paid Days Off: An Interview with Devin Kenny
